meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a loud, harsh sound.
meanings.sent1: The fire alarm blares loudly in case of danger.
meanings.sent2: The trumpet blares during the marching band performance.
meanings.sent3: The car alarm blares so loudly that it startles the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The sirens blares through the city streets, warning of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The speaker blares music at the party, filling the room with energy.

meanings.sent1: The blares of the sirens could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The blares of the horns in the traffic jam were deafening.
meanings.sent3: The blares of the trumpet echoed through the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: The blares of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The blares of the thunderstorm made the windows rattle.
